personalizations.text: An array of messages and their metadata

from.text: The From email address used to deliver the message

reply_to.text: The email address where any replies or bounces will be returned

reply_to_list.text: An array of recipients who will receive replies and/or bounces

subject.text: The global or message level subject of your email

content.text: An array where you can specify the content of your email

attachments.text: An array of objects where you can specify any attachments you want to include

headers.text: An object containing key/value pairs of header names and the value to substitute for them

custom_args.text: Values that are specific to the entire send that will be carried along with the email and its activity data

batch_id.text: An ID representing a batch of emails to be sent at the same time

categories.text: An array of category names for this message

send_at.text: A unix timestamp allowing you to specify when you want your email to be delivered

asm.text: An object allowing you to specify how to handle unsubscribes

ip_pool_name.text: The IP Pool that you would like to send this email from

mail_settings.text: A collection of different mail settings that you can use to specify how you would like this email to be handled

tracking_settings.text: Settings to determine how you would like to track the metrics of how your recipients interact with your email.

friendly_name.text: Optionally set this property to a friendly name for the Event Webhook

oauth_client_id.text: Set this property to the OAuth client ID that SendGrid will pass to your OAuth server or service provider to generate an OAuth access token. When passing data in this property you must also include the oauth_token_url property

oauth_client_secret.text: Set this property to the OAuth client secret that SendGrid will pass to your OAuth server or service provider to generate an OAuth access token

oauth_token_url.text: Set this property to the URL where SendGrid will send the OAuth client ID and client secret to generate an OAuth access token

id.text: The ID of the Event Webhook you want to retrieve.
The ID of the Event Webhook you want to retrieve.

enabled.text: Set this property to true to enable the Event Webhook or false to disable it

url.text: Set this property to the URL where you want the Event Webhook to send event data

group_resubscribe.text: Set this property to true to receive group resubscribe events

delivered.text: Set this property to true to receive delivered events

group_unsubscribe.text: Set this property to true to receive group unsubscribe events

spam_report.text: Set this property to true to receive spam report events.

bounce.text: Set this property to true to receive bounce events

deferred.text: Set this property to true to receive deferred events

unsubscribe.text: Set this property to true to receive unsubscribe events

processed.text: Set this property to true to receive processed events

open.text: Set this property to true to receive open events

click.text: Set this property to true to receive click events

dropped.text: Set this property to true to receive dropped events

meta.description: Get Signed Event Webhook's Public Key

id.text: The ID of the Event Webhook you want to retrieve

url.text: The URL where you would like the test notification to be sent

oauth_client_id.text: The client ID Twilio SendGrid sends to your OAuth server or service provider to generate an OAuth access token

oauth_client_secret.text: The oauth_client_secret is needed only once to create an access token

oauth_token_url.text: The URL where Twilio SendGrid sends the Client ID and Client Secret to generate an access token.

limit.text: The number of statistics to return on each page

offset.text: The number of statistics to skip

aggregated_by.text: How you would like the statistics to by grouped

start_date.text: The starting date of the statistics you want to retrieve

end_date.text: The end date of the statistics you want to retrieve
